posts.title: ICE detains University of Alabama doctoral student as government's college crackdown continues
top_comments: I remember hearing during winter break that exchange students should avoid going home because they might not be allowed back into the US.
Man, I swear this is the kind of stuff that the right wing warned us would happen under liberal government....
Where are the Don't Tread on Me guys now? This is rather...draconian.

I earned my PhD a few years ago. One of the most stressful, engaging, and fucking stressful times of my life. To be suddenly deported? I can't imagine. So much of a PhD program is building and sustaining momentum. To be tanked out like this? These assholes are altering the lives of bright, intelligent, and young people.

So we don't know where he is, what they say he's done, whether he has a lawyer, yet it's a "crackdown" as if there's something justifiable here in need of correction.


Fuck off.
Trump is making all of us less safe. He’s shredding the legal system and the constitution. And he’s crashing the economy.
Whenever you get mad about this, remember that Congress (controlled by Republicans) could stop this at any time - and they choose not to because they like it.
Abducted.  He was abducted not detained.
This is 100% a trial run to cause some fear. This summer is going to have protests en masse and fully expect we'll start seeing even fully legal citizens start to disappear when those begin.
This administration is lawless.

posts.title: Kentucky GOP supermajority overrides nearly all of Democratic governor's vetoes in one day
top_comments:
IIRC they didn't even need a supermajority to override a veto in Kentucky. 


It's one of the few states where a simple majority overrides a veto.

>another that would strip the state’s ability to regulate pollution in certain water sources.

So the "Don't tread on me" crowd is willingly ceding authority to the federal government they demonized for years because now the federal government is as aspirationally fascist as them.

I was listening to a representative from Kentucky (not sure if Congressman or Senator) on Pod Save America. He was saying the impact on Bourbon sales was immediate and impactful to their economy. More interesting was his discussion about the Department of Education and Medicaid cuts. He said that the number 1 employer in most Kentucky towns is the school system, and the loss of block grants will require firing a lot of staff, and the number 2 employer is the local hospital which is funded by Medicaid. He also said 1/2 of the children in the state are covered by Medicaid.

The administration is targeting GOP voters for the most pain. Goofy.
At least they have enough whiskey to drown in.
Keep destroying that local economy Kentucky.
I hope they get everything they voted for.

>Louisville Democrat Sen. Cassie Chambers Armstrong said these programs have already played out in other states and have hurt indigent Medicaid recipients who are already working but fail to fill out burdensome paperwork.

Paperwork for billion $$ companies to prove they aren't destroying the environment or abusing workers rights = Bad

Paperwork for a single mother working 2 jobs to support her kids = Good
I'm not sure of a more elegant way to say this, but every single "lawmaker" involved with this can go fuck themselves with a taxidermied porcupine encased in resin.
Beshear is the only reason I can stand living in this state. I swear I’m so tired of the GOP and their bullshit.

Small gov't, states rights!

>Lawmakers overrode Behsear’s veto of [House Bill 398](https://apps.legislature.ky.gov/record/25rs/hb398.html), which would[ roll back enforcement](https://www.lpm.org/news/2025-03-13/kentucky-bill-to-cut-state-worker-protections-passes-senate-nears-final-passage) of any Kentucky worker safety regulations that are more stringent than federal minimums. Supporters say it will cut down on confusion for employers crossing state lines, but [Beshear argued](https://www.lpm.org/news/2025-03-25/beshear-vetoes-bill-that-would-strip-kentucky-worker-protections) that would come at the expense of state autonomy and worker safety.

Oh wait...

I went to the Smithsonian in 2023 and saw pictures of the KKK gathering on the White House lawn, the text by the photo described the situation and date but was completely neutral about the event. They also have a smashed bus window from an integration era school bus, again, no social commentary, just a statement that it happened because Americans were unhappy with the decision. They also have a case showing a minstrel show suit and black face makeup which is very strange to immortalize. 

I understand that the black history museum is right next door but I really didn’t expect American history to be segregated like that. I mean I should have but that’s my white optimism for ya. I know better now.

posts.title: Judge orders Trump administration to preserve Signal chat on Yemen strikes
top_comments: Serious question, WTF is going to happen if they don't? I mean, they've already broken the law, disobeyed the Scotus... And... No repercussions.
Jeffrey Goldberg has the chat in case the admin, er, "loses" it.

Already deleted.

I'll eat my own ass on camera if I'm wrong.

They might want to think about going with their usual approach of deleting everything and lying.  I'm pretty sure a certain editor in chief will be very happy to share the complete chat with anyone who asks.  Then again, it apparently never occurred to them that if they lied about it he might drop the receipts, so I guess we'll see what happens.
This will go over well

Official communications by US Government employees is already REQUIRED to be preserved. Which is why WE DONT USE FUCKING SIGNAL IN THE FIRST PLACE. 

In the immortal words of Jim Carrey, STOP BREAKING THE LAW, ASSHOLES!!!

The only thing that can stop Trump is congress. And the current one is complicit. 

So, if you want to establish a working system of checks and balances again then do not vote for the republican congressman that is supposed to be serving your district/state. They no longer work for you.
Honestly I’m more afraid of what other things they’ve discussed/are still discussing in Signal that can’t be requested by FOIA.

Just for reference, when Trump promised us all he was going to "lock her up!!!" (how's that project coming along, Donnie?), it was for technical violations of the Federal Records Act. The FBI investigated and concluded a) there was no criminal intent, it was simple incompetence, and b) there was no breach of national security.

There is a presidential version of the FRA called the Presidential Records Act, which is even more restrictive...and Trump violated it on damn near a weekly basis. Every time he tore up an official document--which he did a lot--or deleted a tweet, he was violating the PRA.

And now his minions are back to trampling the FRA. What other (illegal) group chats have they had where they deleted the chat?

The chances this will ever be prosecuted are approximately zero, Republicans don't consider themselves to be responsible for stuff like that. When Colin Powell was SecState, he did pretty much the same thing Hillary Clinton did with the private email server, except he also deleted some *official* mails, which violated the FRA. I must have missed the Faux News OUTRAGE!!!! about that...
but judge, we set the chat to self-delete....

posts.title: Exclusive: FDA staff struggle to meet product review deadlines after DOGE layoffs
top_comments:
This isn't a bug, it's a feature.

1. Fire all the staff so they can't get their reviews and approvals done in a timely manner.  
2. Publicly complain that the FDA approvals are taking too long and regulations are too onerous.  
3. Remove regulations.
3500 FDA employees will be laid off. This is in addition to those already let go

Going back to when America was great and milk producers put formaldehyde in milk to extend the shelf life. Before the FDA all we could do was to plead with the companies to please stop killing kids.

https://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/19th-century-fight-bacteria-ridden-milk-embalming-fluid-180970473/

I am a medical device auditor.  I can remember a time when a [483](https://www.fda.gov/inspections-compliance-enforcement-and-criminal-investigations/inspection-references/fda-form-483-frequently-asked-questions) was something to be feared by corporate executives.  Defending companies from the FDA was a career path. Now, it's barely even heard of.

The FDA was barely surviving as it was.  They were a good organization that [helped a lot of people](https://www.fda.gov/about-fda/fda-history-exhibits/frances-oldham-kelsey-medical-reviewer-famous-averting-public-health-tragedy).  But medical devices and especially pharmaceuticals went the way of Boeing back in [2017](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13771).  With his [newest deregulation efforts](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/01/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-launches-massive-10-to-1-deregulation-initiative/#:~:text=In%20his%20first%20term%2C%20President,for%20everyone%20new%20regulation%20issued.), it really is gone.  This is just another nail in the coffin.  Hopefully we can rebuild someday.

1. Break government

2. Claim government doesn't work

3. Abandon regulatory agencies, privatize program administration.

Enjoy Russia-West.

Think about it this way......

A health inspector isn't necessarily efficient for a business. But we need them to maintain food safety. It's not fraud, it's not a Kabal of deep state food molesters. It's a necessary protection. 

But if everything is looked at through the lens of business and not country. Well, the health inspector can be made to look "fraudulent".

I work at a medical device manufacturer and the documentation and safety guidelines are all targeted at FDA requirements. Audits at the facility are a huge deal, and any pushback on following process gets over ridden because the consequences of a failed audit are not worth the risk. I don't think most companies are going to backslide on purpose but when the watchdog isn't there it becomes much much easier.
The plan to Make America Shittier is working.
Get ready for more food borne illness!
Exclusive: the federal government does in fact provide meaningful services to industry and consumers alike.

posts.title: Measles case confirmed in person who rode Amtrak train to Washington, D.C., health officials say
top_comments: Sure glad that I got a simple injection when I was a child that protects me from getting it

For context, the average person with covid will infect about 3 people.


The average person with measles will infect 12.  It is wildly infectious, and it can kill kids.


There is a reason we worked so hard to get rid of it.
Dude, just drink cod liver oil until you turn yellow and your liver quits

Non responder.
We all have neighbors that are non responders to vaccinations.
That’s another part of the population that is at risk when people don’t vaccinate.
Please vaccinate to protect all of us.

Even though I got my vax as a kid, I am TERRIFIED of catching it. It's, what, a 3% chance of getting it? However, with how it basically resets your immune system, it'd easily kill me. I'm chronically ill with multiple autoimmune disorders, I'm going full lock down if it's spotted in AZ
We still have health officials?
It would be poetic justice if RFK Jr gets it.

>Before becoming contagious, the individual with measles had flown from Minnesota into Reagan National Airport, a spokesperson for the D.C. Health Department told CBS News. Neither the identity nor a description of the individual has been released, but the spokesperson said they were vaccinated against measles.

Well that's scary in multiple ways.  Vaccination isn't 100% and immunity can fade with time, which is why a bunch of anti-vaxxers deciding they're going to make their arrogance everyone else's problem is such a bad scenario.

PSA:

* If you were vaccinated before 1968, get your immunity checked or just get the MMR vaccine. Two vaccines were introduced in 1963 but both were less effective than the 1968 vaccine we use today. Note: You might want to get two doses, since you've never had the MMR that includes the more effective vaccine.
* If you were vaccinated between 1968 and 1989, get your immunity checked or just get another MMR vaccine. Before 1989, they only gave a single dose. Two doses are more effective. 
* If you were born before or in 1957, you've almost certainly been exposed already and you're immune. 
* If you were vaccinated after 1989, you're almost certainly good. But if your insurance pays for it and you're worried, get checked.
Every state needs to just ban people from texas

posts.title: Core inflation in February hits 2.8%, higher than expected; spending increases 0.4%
top_comments: It should be noted that the 0.4% consumer spending increase is LOWER than the forecast of 0.5%

Please note several things.

1. The underlying report is incredibly informative.

2. Half of the increase in month-over-month inflation growth is from shelters. However, there is a lag in this data reflecting supply and demand changes. 

3. Tremendous growth in food away from home (FAFH) and general services is likely indicative of broader trends that will become more apparent soon. 

4. Couple this with the UMich consumer sentiment and consumer expectations surveys. Both of which came in worse than expected, with inflation being a primary drag.

Are we done winning yet?
Atlanta Fed revised Q1 GDP decline to -2.8 again. Remarkable that it was +3.9 on Feb 2nd. We sure are winning!!
Narrator- “And then it got worse”
I tend to watch my weekly supermarket checkout, which has averaged $132 a week for 2 adults in January, $177 a week in February, and now $184 in March.… that’s almost a 40% jump in two months.
Bad news? Sounds like a witch hunt to me. /s
So its bad news on both fronts. Higher inflation, lower spending. All the lights are blinking red right now.

In other news, 


Duh
But hey, at least transgender kids can’t play sports now, so it all evens out. /s
A week ago here in Idaho gas was about $3 for basic unleaded.  It's not $3.30.  Time to break out the "I did that" sticker yet?

https://energyandcleanair.org/wp/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/image-14.png

This headline and article is kinda trash. Just for the fact that it disproves itself within the first couple paragraphs.

*A report released on Thursday by Ember, an energy think tank, estimates that European purchases of Russian gas amounted to 21.9 billion euros ($23.6bn) last year, compared with 18.7 billion euros ($20.17bn) in financial aid to Ukraine.*

*That figure did not include military aid.*

Imagine not including one of the biggest forms of aid going into Ukraine.

Not to mention the two largest and consistent purchasers of Russian energy were Hungary and Slovakia, both currently being run by Pro-Russian leaders. If a nation should be chastised it should be France specifically because of their large increase of Russian LNG over the fall months of 2024, but overall they have greatly reduced their reliance on Russian energy. posts.title: Core inflation in February hits 2.8%, higher than expected; spending increases 0.4%
top_comments: It should be noted that the 0.4% consumer spending increase is LOWER than the forecast of 0.5%

Please note several things.

1. The underlying report is incredibly informative.

2. Half of the increase in month-over-month inflation growth is from shelters. However, there is a lag in this data reflecting supply and demand changes. 

3. Tremendous growth in food away from home (FAFH) and general services is likely indicative of broader trends that will become more apparent soon. 

4. Couple this with the UMich consumer sentiment and consumer expectations surveys. Both of which came in worse than expected, with inflation being a primary drag.

Are we done winning yet?
Atlanta Fed revised Q1 GDP decline to -2.8 again. Remarkable that it was +3.9 on Feb 2nd. We sure are winning!!
Narrator- “And then it got worse”
I tend to watch my weekly supermarket checkout, which has averaged $132 a week for 2 adults in January, $177 a week in February, and now $184 in March.… that’s almost a 40% jump in two months.
Bad news? Sounds like a witch hunt to me. /s
So its bad news on both fronts. Higher inflation, lower spending. All the lights are blinking red right now.

posts.title: Strong 7.7-magnitude earthquake strikes Myanmar, with tremors felt in neighbouring Thailand
top_comments: I am burmese and I am pretty sure 3 happened in 30 minutes, the earthquakes happened in the centre, I live in Yangon which is about 350 miles away and it still shook very hard here, Sagaing Bridge which is a very long bridge collapsed, also in the centre, the 2nd most populous city in the country mandalay, there were so many buildings collapsed.
This is really bad, the infrastructure won’t be up to a quake that big. It’ll be a few days before we’ll see the effects of this. Another brutal blow for Myanmar.

Is Myanmar pretty closed off?
The footage of the high rise under construction collapsing in Bangkok is crazy, and that was "Light Shaking" from this quake according to USGS.
This gave me so much anxiety. Gonna be days until we know the effects. Thoughts are with them.

This looks really bad, [USGS](https://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/eventpage/us7000pn9s/pager) is painting a really grim picture on potential casualties. Epicenter is right next to the second largest city in Myanmar. The people there has already gone through way too much in recent years.
